name: Pre-process from Input
Pre-process data
info:
# Function to preprocess data.

### Returns JSON with:
 - node // (tower) detail information
 - node_name
 - sensor information, 
 - payload, 
 - measure,
 - tentononc
 - processed_date
 - processed_time
 - processed_timestamp
 - qos
 - retain


### Info on data:
 - tentononc = something from the "data.topic", always present. Its combination of two numbers and colon.

func:
msg.topic = `INSERT INTO measurements (node_name, senzor, cidlo, payload, time_stamp) VALUES ("${msg.params.$node_name}", "${msg.params.$senzor}", "${msg.params.$measured_variable}", "${msg.params.$payload}", "${msg.params.$processed_timestamp}")`

return msg;

name: Pre-process from Input
Pre-process data
info:
# Function to preprocess data.

### Returns JSON with:
 - node // (tower) detail information
 - node_name
 - sensor information, 
 - payload, 
 - measure,
 - tentononc
 - processed_date
 - processed_time
 - processed_timestamp
 - qos
 - retain


### Info on data:
 - tentononc = something from the "data.topic", always present. Its combination of two numbers and colon.
 
### Calculating timeframes for grouping

name: SQLite INSERT
func:
msg.topic = `INSERT INTO measurements (node_name, sensor, detector, payload, time_stamp, time_stamp_fiveMinutes, time_stamp_hourly, time_stamp_daily, time_stamp_weekly) VALUES ("${msg.params.$node_name}", "${msg.params.$senzor}", "${msg.params.$measured_variable}", "${msg.params.$payload}", "${msg.params.$processed_timestamp}", "${msg.params.$time_stamp_fiveMinutes}", "${msg.params.$time_stamp_hourly}", "${msg.params.$time_stamp_daily}", "${msg.params.$time_stamp_weekly}")`

return msg;

sql: SELECT * FROM measurements WHERE transfered_timestamp IS NULL LIMIT 100;
name: SQLite SELECT DATA FOR TRANSFER
Create transfered_timestamp
SQLite UPDATE Transfer params

info: # Sync gateway data to cloud DB based on timer and updates transfer data in gateway DB.

name: Records to one-by-one
Timed delete of synced data (week and more old)
info: # Sync gateway data to cloud DB based on timer and updates transfer data in gateway DB.

sql: DELETE FROM measurements WHERE transfered_timestamp is not null and (((select strftime('%s', 'now')) *1000) - time_stamp) > 1642855186
name: SQLite DELETE
Timed delete of 2 year and more old data

sql: DELETE FROM measurements WHERE (((select strftime('%s', 'now')) *1000) - time_stamp) > 1580304222
name: SQLite DELETE
Transform data for chart
SQL select all data
Transform to
Transform from
SQL select last known value
func:
msg.topic = `SELECT * from measurements where (sensor, detector, time_stamp) in (select sensor, detector, max(time_stamp) from measurements where sensor != "undefined" AND gateway = "${msg.filters.gateway}" and node_name = "${msg.filters.nodes}" group by detector)`

return msg;

name: SQL select with filters
func:
msg.topic = `SELECT distinct(gateway) FROM measurements `

return msg;

name: SQL select last known value
SQL select with filters
func:
msg.topic = `SELECT distinct node_name FROM measurements where gateway = "${msg.payload}"`

return msg;

name: Set config for GW
Prepare headers
Prepare login credentials
Get GW token from headers
Fill agregation
SQL select default state
func:
msg.topic = `SELECT sensor, payload, time_stamp from (SELECT * from measurements where  ${msg.filters.nodesSQL} ${msg.filters.gatewaySQL}  time_stamp <= "${msg.filters.to}"  order by time_stamp desc) group by sensor`
msg.maxAllowed = msg.payload[0].maxCapacity
msg.volume = msg.payload[0].len * msg.payload[0].hei * msg.payload[0].wid
return msg;

SQL select node dimensions
func:
msg.topic = msg.filters.gateway && msg.filters.nodes ? `SELECT * from nodes where gateway = "${msg.filters.gateway}" and node_name = "${msg.filters.nodes}" LIMIT 1` : `SELECT * from nodes LIMIT 1`

return msg;

name: SQLite Update
func:
msg.topic = `UPDATE nodes SET wid = ${msg.payload.width}, hei = ${msg.payload.height}, len = ${msg.payload.length}, maxCapacity = ${msg.payload.maxCapacity} where node_name = "${msg.payload.nodes}" AND gateway = "${msg.payload.gateway}"`



return msg
